alert.note: Alert for Inland Cameron (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 05 at 4:00PM CDT by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Cameron County through 445 PM CDT... At 359 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Gladys Porter Zoo, or over Downtown Brownsville, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cameron Park, Downtown Brownsville, Southmost, Port Of Brownsville, Brownsville, Lincoln Park, B I S D Administration Building, Longoria Elementary School, Sams Memorial Stadium, and Hanna High School. This includes the following highways... Interstate Highway 69 E between mile markers 1 and 6. US Highway 281 between mile markers 834 and 838. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
